abstract: Toyota’s decision to halt manufacturing and sales of most of its cars in America could hurt the reputation of other Japanese businesses, analysts said.
snippet: Toyota’s decision to halt manufacturing and sales of most of its cars in America could hurt the reputation of other Japanese businesses, analysts said.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO  As Toyota’s problems mounted in North America with the announcement of a halt to sales and manufacturing of the bulk of its cars, commentators in Japan fretted Wednesday that the automaker’s problems could seriously hurt the reputation of the rest of Japan’s manufacturing sector.

headline.main: Toyota’s Woes in America Raise Concern in Japan
headline.print_headline: Toyota’s Woes in U.S. Raise Concern in Japan

abstract: Dealers say they are trying to operate normally a day after Toyota decided to halt sales and production of eight models because of safety concerns.
snippet: Dealers say they are trying to operate normally a day after Toyota decided to halt sales and production of eight models because of safety concerns.
lead_paragraph: Toyota dealers across the country faced a cacophony of messages on Wednesday: calls from panicky customers wondering whether their cars needed repair, pages of marching orders faxed from corporate headquarters, e-mail messages from salesmen asking if paychecks would be trimmed.

headline.main: For Toyota Dealers, a Day of Patience and Preparation
headline.print_headline: For Toyota Dealers, a Day of Patience and Preparation

abstract: In its successful drive to become No. 1 in worldwide sales, Toyota may have left its reputation vulnerable.
snippet: In its successful drive to become No. 1 in worldwide sales, Toyota may have left its reputation vulnerable.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT  Toyota executives set an ambitious goal in 2002 to own 15 percent of the global auto industry by 2010, meaning it would surpass General Motors as the world’s largest carmaker. To get there, it would have to grow by 50 percent. It would have to build new plants in the United States, China, and elsewhere in Asia, and introduce dozens of new models.

headline.main: Rapid Growth Has Its Perils, Toyota Learns
headline.print_headline: Rapid Growth Has Its Perils, Toyota Learns

byline.original: By Micheline Maynard and Hiroko Tabuchi
